image.altText: A number of officials pose for a picture next to a grey weapon

props.synopsis: The Defence Department told the ABC that “Australia has not supplied weapons or ammunition to Israel” since the Gaza war began in 2023.

title.children: Australian weapon trialled by Israel's military ahead of potential sale

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a desk and gestures with his hands while speaking.

props.synopsis: US markets plunge again as optimism over President Donald Trump's tariffs "pause" is overshadowed by his escalating trade war with China, which the Whie House says will now be hit with a 145 per cent tariff.

title.children: US markets plunge again as White House confirms China tariff even higher

image.altText: A man in a suit with pale hair stares into the camera

props.synopsis: Of all Trump's miscalculations this week, his biggest miscalculation of all may be assuming that China would not hit back, using the economic power that the Chinese Communist Party has been amassing for decades, but until recently, has not fully deployed.

title.children: Why Trump's China trade war may be 'one of history's greatest acts of self-harm'

image.altText: Five people on a beach are shown from behind running into the water as the sun rises.

props.synopsis: A coal industry-funded group campaigning against progressive candidates in the federal election has deleted two months of social media posts after being pulled up by the Australian Electoral Commission over unauthorised content.

title.children: Coal industry-funded group deletes social media posts after AEC intervention

image.altText: Composite of two ad campaigns, one of Anthony Albanese and one of Peter Dutton.

props.synopsis: Third parties including Clive Palmer's Trumpet of Patriots, conservative group Advance and Climate 200 have also funnelled significant amounts into online advertising to start the election campaign.

title.children: Major parties spend $1.4m on online ads in week one of campaign

image.altText: A photo of the Nickel factory sitting by the coast under blue skies.

props.synopsis: A billion-dollar bet on nickel mining gave many New Caledonians hopes of economic prosperity and political independence. But after the market turned, the mine has left behind a ghost town full of broken hearts.

title.children: Nickel, paradise and 'emancipation': Mining bust creates ghost towns

image.altText: Collage of electricity bill behind a green mountain with powerlines on orange background.

props.synopsis: We take a closer look at the average power bill to see which sections Australians should be keeping an eye on or asking questions about.

title.children: Understanding power bills and how consumers are using this to save

image.altText: Two men wearing suits speak

props.synopsis: Election results trigger, or subsequently lead to, leadership resets. Even in the turmoil of a campaign, players will also have their eyes on the future.

title.children: Will both parties see a leadership change in the next parliament?

image.altText: Donald Trump shows a signed document in the Oval Office at the White House

props.synopsis: With China's economy still being threatened, consumer confidence already falling and business facing extraordinary levels of uncertainty, the risk for Australia is that the economy could falter.

title.children: How will the leader of the free world’s flip-flopping affect your household?

image.altText: US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping walk away from each other at a G20 summit in Japan, 2019.

props.synopsis: The ongoing US-China trade war is taking its toll on Beijing. But here's how China is softening the blow, and how it could hit back against US tariffs.

title.children: How China could use its toolbox to inflict pain in US trade war

image.altText: The Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge just after sunset.

props.synopsis: Since last August, Australia has baked through above-average temperatures and the BOM is predicting another winter of unseasonable heat.

title.children: BOM predicts one of the warmest winters on record

image.altText: Annette looks into the camera with a solemn expression, a photo of her deceased son hangs on the wall.

props.synopsis: Australian Super is one of two super funds being sued by ASIC over the handling of death benefit claims. A First Nations family says a deceased family member was mistreated by the fund.

title.children: Super industry on notice to 'lift their game' ASIC commissioner warns

image.altText: Pauline Hanson in the senate

props.synopsis: One Nation leader Pauline Hanson has taken credit for major party policies during a blistering and rare appearance on 7.30, where she also said she has no regrets in her political career.

title.children: No regrets for Pauline Hanson during controversial career

image.altText: A soldier is seen partially inside a tank.

props.synopsis: By the time MP Mike Martin described it as "inevitable" last month, conscription was well and truly back in Britain's national conversation, and some people are not against the idea.

title.children: Conscription no longer dirty word for some Brits concerned about Putin

image.altText: Rows of cars in a car park, with stacked shipping containers behind them.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton says a scheme to cut the emissions of cars and encourage electric vehicle uptake will be abolished under a Coalition government.

title.children: Coalition to abolish fuel efficiency penalties, dubbing them 'unfair tax'

image.altText: A woman takes a photograph of illuminated cherry blossoms in full bloom

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar has been tracking lower against all major currencies, making overseas travel more expensive in popular tourist destinations.

title.children: $25 for a glass of wine: Why you may want to rethink overseas plans

image.altText: Patrick Dangerfield screams in delight as teammates mob him

props.synopsis: With the whole AFL watching, Adelaide had everything set up for its perfect Gather Round welcome, only for Geelong to stroll in, crash the party and ransack the house on the way out.

title.children: As Adelaide welcomed the AFL to its party, Geelong ransacked the house

image.altText: Up close of a woman sitting behind a glass cage in a court room in Russia

props.synopsis: Ksenia Karelina has been released in a swap with the United States for a German-Russian citizen accused of exporting sensitive US electronics for use in Russia's military.

title.children: US-Russian jailed for charity donation to Ukraine freed in prisoner swap

image.altText: The Māori Party caucus after the protest inside the chamber.

props.synopsis: New Zealand's Treaty Principles Bill has been voted down in the country's parliament, killing off the controversial piece of proposed legislation.

title.children: 'Absolutely annihilated': NZ bill that took country to brink voted down

image.altText: A man in an orange coloured t-shirt looks sternly away from the artist who has sketched him in a courtroom setting

props.synopsis: Tahawwur Hussain Rana has long denied any involvement in the Mumbai terror attacks which killed more than 160 people in 2008.

title.children: A man accused of plotting 'India's 9/11' has been extradited to New Delhi

image.altText: A crowd of people, some of whom are holding posters of people

props.synopsis: The death toll after a roof collapsed at a crowded nightclub in the Dominican Republic has climbed to 218, in the Caribbean nation's worst disaster in decades.

title.children: Death toll in Dominican nightclub disaster rises to 218

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands in front of flags of Australia and China.

props.synopsis: China's ambassador suggested Australia should stand in "solidarity" with China against tariffs, but Deputy PM Richard Marles said Australia would stand up for its own interests.

title.children: Marles says Australia will not 'join hands' with China against Trump

image.altText: Firefighters in a burnt out building

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating the cause of the blaze, and whether there were "any fire safety non-compliances".

title.children: Australian killed in fire at kids' cooking school in Singapore

image.altText: A freestanding Victorian-era house painted white with black wrought iron balustrades on the lefthand side

props.synopsis: What would you risk for the house of your dreams? That's the question Melbourne couple Stephanie and Paul Ryan grappled with when the opportunity arose to buy a rundown Victorian-era house that's under the threat of compulsory acquisition.

title.children: Couple's gamble on forever home could mean 'torturous' forced sale

image.altText: Prada loge reads simply 'prada'

props.synopsis: Versace is making its way back home after Prada Group announced a deal to buy the Italian label from a US luxury group under terms that value the fashion house at $2.2 billion.

title.children: Prada to buy rival fashion house Versace in $2.2 billion deal

image.altText: trump dinner

props.synopsis: The US president was confronted by a force far greater than his own and the office he now holds overnight. The bond market, an arena where brutality knows no bounds and where the participants take no prisoners.

title.children: Donald Trump ran into a brick wall and had no option but to back down

image.altText: Panthers coach Ivan Cleary reacts during a press conference, holding his head up with one hand

props.synopsis: The Penrith Panthers will need to rewrite the record books in 2025 if they are to continue their historic success and claim a fifth-straight premiership.

title.children: Panthers must achieve 117-year first to continue premiership dynasty

image.altText: In vitro fertilisation

props.synopsis: Monash IVF has apologised after a woman unknowingly gave birth to a stranger's baby after the wrong embryo was transferred.

title.children: Woman gives birth to stranger's baby in Monash IVF embryo mix-up

image.altText: Cathy crouched down with her chooks

props.synopsis: With egg shortages expected to last several years, demand for backyard chickens is soaring. Here's what you need to know before adopting some for yourself.

title.children: Considering adopting chickens in the egg shortage? Read this first

image.altText: The tail of a Virgin Australia plane on the tarmac, with other planes lines up behind it.

props.synopsis: Customers were overcharged when changes were made to their itineraries, according to a spokesperson from Virgin Australia.

title.children: 'We sincerely apologise': Virgin to refund 61,000 overcharged customers

props.synopsis: Police are investigating an alleged assault on a beach on the Sunshine Coast that left a 60-year-old woman with broken ribs, spinal fractures, a fractured ankle, and a lacerated liver.

title.children: Woman suffers spinal injuries after dog owner 'rugby tackle' on beach

image.altText: A woman with a shaved head reaches out at a woman carrying a toddler, who both have their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old woman who randomly attacked a toddler and an elderly woman in separate assaults in Perth is jailed for 18 months.

title.children: 'Out of control': Perth woman jailed for assaults on toddler, elderly woman

image.altText: Workers

props.synopsis: Six people contracted the infectious disease after spending time in Sydney's CBD over the past three weeks, according to NSW Health.

title.children: Health warning for people who have been in Sydney CBD over past 10 days

image.altText: A boa constrictor large snake slithering along a footpath near a bridge on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The large snake was spotted slithering down a footpath onto sand near a Sylvania bridge in Sydney's south.

title.children: Boa constrictor captured after days of being on the loose in Sydney's south
